commit_message:
fix bad warning about max depth.

closes #242

enable s3 and gcs in htslib

see #196
use csi index for bams to support larger organisms
only add read1 and test read1 for tree
add message to help find bad file from failed merge
lower z score. this improves DHFFC filtering 1 or 2%
don't leave orphaned duphold processes when something fails

fix for badsplit

update logic thanks to feedback from @ernfrid

this now checks the number of matched bases only.
for multiple splits, there will be multiple soft-clips so we
can simply count the number of matches.
add plot of split+disc reads before and after filtering
add numbers of split and discordant reads to header

fix non termination in interchromfilter (#38)

* fix non termination in interchromfilter

reads with unmapped mates can get into discordants
this fix makes sure that does not result in non-termination.

* check in all cases that j gets increased

* add goleft to image
update mosdepth to use --fast-mode from latest version
update svtyper and history and version

Introduce filtering of lone interchromosomals (#31)

This introduces a filter that scans the genome in 10kb windows and
removes interchromosomal reads where no other interchromosomal falls
within the same window.
fix for debugging small input with not enough reads to generate distribution
filter cnvnator calls in N regions

simplify filtering rules

this is much less stringent but also simplifies the explanation and
logic.
add final log message of percent of original reads remaining

simplify filtering rules and be more careful about reads that span events

allow sending args to the cram reader
make directories if they don't exist.
update to latest duphold args to allow sending a GATK vcf

remove splitters to excluded chroms

closes #25
more conservative event filter (allow up to 2 I, D events)

remove temp csi file from duphold.

closes #24
check number of I or D events > 1
adjust NM counts for insertions and deletions

more careful about removing reads that are soft-clipped on both ends

thanks @ernfrid for noting this.

soft-clipping on both ends can happen for short inversions. this
change makes it so that smoove will only discard reads with soft
clips on both ends if they dont look like inversions--that is
if they don't have the same orientation as their mate.

duphold

this is an initial inclusion of duphold via a command-line flag.
it runs duphold serially on each sample. so, when run in cohort
mode with e.g. 20 samples and 20 threads, the duphold part will only
be able to use about 4 threads. For single (or < 4 samples) mode,
the duphold part will parallelize as expected up to ~4 threads.
this will improve in a future commit or version.
add hidden option to keep reference calls in smoove call

fix flipped END, START

closes #21

also increase the min weight
better error message in case of merge fail
don't use --sum. reduces size of CI intervals
add note about new het quality stuff

add SHQ: smoove het-quality

samples with a score of 4 are very confident hets. with 1 are bad.

remove reads with qual < 50 and split to a chrom that's not the same as

the mate chrom

remove any read with > 5 mismatches.

this does not affect true positives in my CHM1-CHM13 pseudo-diploid
test-case but does remove about 1/3rd of false positives.
bump max reads to svtyper avoids some false negatives
annotate: 'gene' and 'upstream' now added to annotation

add annotate command

addresses #11.

this does not use vcfanno and instead reads into an interval tree.
this is necessary since adding a useful gene-name to the INFO requires understanding/keeping
the hierarchical structure in the gff
reorganize caller so programs remain in specified order

update docker to point to main svtyper branch

see: https://github.com/hall-lab/svtyper/pull/78#issuecomment-377999745

fix annotate command. add tests (#15)

closes #14
don't fail on latest mosdepth layout
add -x to remove the PRPOS and PREND where appropriate
Remove long lumpy INFO annotations PRPOS and PREND (#12)

add note about bcftools version

re #10
note that it's for short reads

rename to "population-level" calling

clean up vestiges of old name.

Sub commands (#9)

* start of refactoring

* more progress on refactor

* lumpy as standalone

* incremental fixes

* single CLI

* still run other filters even without mosdepth

* allow lumpy to use svtyper directly

* filter BNDs with too little support

* add BND filtering inside of lumpy

* allow skipping extra filters

* add merge command and allow svtyper to keep reference calls

* rename everything to smoove

* show installed software in main command

* filter cnvnator calls on q0 column

* check file sizes in paste

also small opt in svtyper

* parallelization fixes

* more error checking

* update readme with new setup
output probabilities and make a version number
add all decoys to default exclude and fix off-by-one
avoid more problems with crams and hg38

add another pass for evidence window

removes an additional 50-60% of the data.

use ubuntu root for much faster build.

add YEPP instructions to sh, but it doesn't seem to work.

write to tmp files with lumpy-smoother

then copy to .disc.bam and .split.bam on success

also use 2 CPUs to calculate bam stats.

remove singletons from discordant bam as final pass

closes #4.

This final pass removes ~20-40% of the discordant reads that remain
after previous filters.
no entry-point and fix readme formatting

filter on mapping quality before sending to lumpy

closes #3. This actually removes another few % after
all other filters (though in practice, it is now applied first).

This offloads work from lumpy into lumpy-smoother where it can be
parallelized.

move exclude region filtering into lumpy-filter

closes #2

this does seem to improve performance dramatically as on my
test-case with 35 samples, lumpy is now able to keep about
a dozen svtyper processes busy whereas before it was limited
to ~ 5.
also remove if mate id is in the filter chroms list

add larger buffer on vcf channel

mostly important when lumpy is running and first svtyper process is still calculating metrics

Docker (#1)

* start of docker container

* add filtering with mosdepth

* add dockerhub link
